info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 7:30AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND CONTINUES TO AFFECT PARTS OF WYOMING...GENESEE...NIAGARA...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one-half mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. In addition, snow is beginning to increase over the Buffalo Northtowns and into southern portions of Niagara County. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 725 AM EST, a lake effect snow band was over Buffalo extending into western Genesee county. The lake effect snow band was nearly stationary. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Batavia, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Elma, Pendleton, Marilla, Pembroke and Bennington. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 56 and 48A. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
